theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Neurodegeneration and Protein Oxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced protein oxidation and neuronal death mechanisms in brain aging and neurodegenerative diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Neurodegeneration and Protein Oxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes free oxygen radical damage to brain macromolecules, mitochondrial dysfunction, and neuronal loss.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative protein damage, especially dityrosine cross-linking in muscle tissues and lifespan effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress, antioxidant decline, and vitamin E effects on lipid peroxidation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mitochondrial ROS production, mtDNA mutations, and genetic evidence linking mitochondrial oxidative damage to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details accumulation of mtDNA deletions caused by mitochondrial ROS and their impact on tissue function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS as aging drivers, imbalance of oxidants/antioxidants, and antioxidant defense network status.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, antioxidant defenses, and genetic lifespan modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses accumulation of oxidative damage, causal role of free radicals, and antioxidant intervention hypothesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Neurodegeneration and Protein Oxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on free radical-induced oxidative damage to neuronal membranes and receptor function loss in aging brain.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Stem Cell Exhaustion-Linked Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS-induced DNA damage, telomere dynamics, and hematopoietic stem cell aging under oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights ROS as causal agents, protein carbonylation accumulation, and decline in antioxidant and proteolytic systems.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS as causal agents, oxidative damage accumulation in skeletal muscle, antioxidant decline, and mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage accumulation with age, ROS scavenging enzymes, and aging in C. elegans.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS, oxidative stress, mitochondrial dysfunction, and antioxidant defense systems to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on free radicals causing oxidative stress imbalance, cumulative damage, and aging-related inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Semiconductive Protein Model of Free Radical Theory in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes oxygen free radicals have essential physiological roles in protein semiconductivity and synaptic function, with aging linked to altered radical effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details free radical-induced protein oxidation, proteasome degradation of oxidized proteins, and age-related proteasome inhibition.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes free radicals as primary cause, oxidative damage to macromolecules, and oxidant/antioxidant imbalance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage accumulation, cellular response to oxidative stress, and altered signaling pathways with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Stem Cell Exhaustion-Linked Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights ROS-induced DNA damage, antioxidant defenses, DNA repair capacity decline, and mutation accumulation with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-driven molecular damage, antioxidant defense network decline, and disturbed balance between cell proliferation and death.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS as causal agents, oxidative damage accumulation, antioxidant enzymes, and genetic modulation of oxidative stress resistance.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes free radical damage as primary cause, oxidative damage accumulation, and extension to oxidative stress theory.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Aging in Protein Oxidation and Muscle Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details free radical-mediated protein oxidation, metal-catalyzed oxidation, and age-related accumulation of oxidized proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Peroxisomal Function-Linked Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on peroxisomes' role in ROS detoxification, decline in peroxisomal function with age, and impact on oxidative damage and aging.
